title: Director, Social Media
description: The Role:Wpromote is looking for a Director of Social to own and evolve the agency’s social media presence.

raw.title: Director, Social Media
raw.excerpt: The Role:Wpromote is looking for a Director of Social to own and evolve the agency’s social media presence.
raw.description:
The Role:

Wpromote is looking for a Director of Social to own and evolve the agency’s social media presence. This is a non-client-facing, internal brand leadership role responsible for shaping how Wpromote shows up on social through content, community, and the voices of our people. This role will oversee three core areas of responsibility: organic social strategy and content for agency-owned channels, with an initial focus on LinkedIn and Instagram; employee advocacy across the organization; and executive social, where you’ll partner with senior leaders to elevate their social presence.
This role is both highly strategic and highly hands-on, requiring deep experience in social storytelling, content creation (especially social video), and platform-native best practices. This is a director-level individual contributor role within a lean marketing organization, requiring both strategic ownership of the agency’s social presence and hands-on execution across content, community, and executive social. The role will report into the VP, Content & Comms.
At Wpromote, we believe that great work is only possible with great people. Our goal is to build a better, more inclusive work environment and support our people at every stage of their careers by prioritizing a strong work-life balance through our policies and benefits listed below. As a Best Place to Work according to both Ad Age and Glassdoor and Adweek’s Fastest Growing Digital Agency, we are moving fast to expand our teams and bring new experts into the fold to keep pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in marketing.
We offer:
-Remote-first culture
-Unlimited PTO
-Extended Holiday break (Winter)
-Flexible schedules
-Work from anywhere options*
-100% paid parental leave
-401(k) matching
-Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Pet Insurance
-Sponsored life insurance
-Short Term Disability insurance and additional voluntary insurance
-Annual Class Pass credits and more!
The anticipated annual salary for this role will range from $110,000- $130,000, based on consideration of a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, education and certifications, competitive benchmarks, scope of responsibility, market dynamics, geographic location, and respective state’s salary threshold for exempt employees. At Wpromote, pay ranges are subject to change and are based on specific market medians for similar jobs according to third-party salary benchmark surveys. Individual pay within that range can vary due to skills, experience, and available budget. The total compensation package for this role will include benefits (listed above) and an annual performance bonus.
This role has an associated annual target bonus component which is paid out based on a number of factors which include Company performance, department performance, and individual performance. Bonuses are not guaranteed and you must be an active employee in good standing and not on a Performance Improvement Plan to be eligible for the annual bonus.
*This position may be performed remotely in most states within the US, with some exclusions
**While this role offers the flexibility to work remotely, we have office hubs in Los Angeles, Chicago, and New York, where you can join in on learning and development opportunities, fun events, take advantage of a space to work, and collaborate in person!
***This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship
Important Notice: Beware of Job Scams
Wpromote recruiting communications will only be sent through our official channels via wpromote.com email addresses. If you see a posting elsewhere that is not reflected on Wpromote.com/careers, it may be a fraudulent posting. We do not require payment or fees during the hiring process nor do we request sensitive information, such as Social Security numbers or payment details. Please safeguard yourself against possible scams and contact us if you encounter any suspicious activity.

You Will Be

  • Owning Agency Organic Social Strategy & Content, including:
  • Defining and owning the organic social strategy for the agency across all social channels, including creating and maintaining a content calendar and setting priorities, standards, and direction aligned to brand, marketing, and business goals
  • Overseeing the development of consistent, diversified social posts that include static images, carousels, and short-form video to support business goals and talent acquisition
  • ranslating agency POVs, thought leadership, cultural moments, and wins into compelling, platform-native social stories
  • Staying current on social platform trends, formats, and algorithm shifts, including experimenting with new formats and channels
  • Defining and evolving success metrics for Wpromote’s social presence across awareness, engagement, and brand and business impact
  • Setting priorities and making tradeoff decisions across social initiatives to ensure focus, quality, and sustainable execution within a lean team
  • Leading Content Creation & Social Video:
  • Acting as a creative lead and hands-on contributor, particularly for social video content (e.g., LinkedIn video, Instagram Reels)
  • Partnering with internal teams and leaders to capture authentic, high-performing content, including filming, direction, and editing when needed
  • Establishing clear creative standards and best practices for social content across the agency
  • Traveling periodically to capture real-time social content at industry conferences, agency-hosted events, leadership summits, and more
  • Managing freelance and creator relationships as necessary
  • Setting the strategy for live event coverage and taking initiative on-site with video, interviews, and production on video
  • Building & Scaling Employee Advocacy
  • Owning and scaling Wpromote’s employee advocacy strategy, empowering employees to show up confidently and consistently on social
  • Creating scalable systems, training, and ready-to-share content that make participation easy and authentic
  • Partnering with People Operations, Talent Acquisition, and Marketing teams to align advocacy efforts with recruiting, culture, and brand initiatives
  • Reporting on advocacy initiatives to evaluate the impact on Wpromote’s brand and business and drive decision-making
  • Elevating Executive Social Presence:
  • Partnering with key agency leaders to level up their social presence and thought leadership
  • Providing strategic guidance, content ideation, editing, and posting support tailored to each leader’s voice and goals
  • Helping executives navigate LinkedIn best practices, content formats, and engagement strategies

You Must Have

  • 7–10 years of experience in organic social media, with at least 3+ years in a senior- or director-level role
  • Proven experience leading organic social strategy for a brand or agency (internal brand experience strongly preferred)
  • Strong hands-on content creation experience, including social video (concepting, directing, and/or editing)
  • Deep expertise in LinkedIn and Instagram, with experience across TikTok, Snap, and other video-based social platforms, including platform-native formats and best practices
  • Experience building or managing employee advocacy and/or executive social programs
  • Strong strategic thinking skills paired with a willingness to roll up your sleeves and create
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to adapt tone across audiences and platforms
  • Comfort partnering with senior leaders and providing clear, confident social guidance
  • A strong point of view on what great organic social looks like and how to evolve it over time
  • A great sense of humor and an appetite for provocative content
  • Willingness and ability to travel periodically for agency events, industry conferences, leadership summits, and on-site content production
Wpromote is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace.
Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Wpromote.
This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. For more information on E Verify, or if you believe that your employer has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact DHS.

title: Digital PR Specialist
description: About Inspira EducationInspira Education Group is one of the fastest-growing edtech startups in the US.

raw.title: Digital PR Specialist
raw.excerpt: About Inspira EducationInspira Education Group is one of the fastest-growing edtech startups in the US.
raw.description:
About Inspira Education

Inspira Education Group is one of the fastest-growing edtech startups in the US. We started with a simple mission to democratize access to high-quality coaching so that every student in the world has an equal opportunity to access the best opportunities.

As the world’s leading network of top admissions coaches in medical, legal, business, and college studies, we’re building software and services in one place—disrupting long-entrenched application processes with products and experiences that strive to provide an equal platform for candidates from diverse backgrounds worldwide.

As one of the fastest-growing edtech firms in the world, we are backed by some of the leading venture capital firms and investors in the world, including Zeev Ventures, Quiet Capital, Craft Ventures, Jeff Fluhr (Founder of Stubhub), and David Sacks (Former COO of PayPal and Founder of Yammer).

The Role

We are currently seeking a creative and detail-oriented Digital PR Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will play a vital part in strengthening the online authority of our brands (Inspira Advantage, Quad Education, and Juris Education) by identifying high-quality backlink opportunities, executing personalized outreach campaigns, and building long-term relationships with publishers, bloggers, and industry professionals.

Led by a team of former admissions committee officers from some of the most prestigious schools, Inspira’s mission is to democratize access to higher education across millions of deserving students in the world, so that their education and life outcomes do not get determined by a zipcode or resources of their high schools. Inspira has thus built one of the deepest benches of admissions counselors in the world who support candidates with all the aspects of their application process and help them position the best version of themselves.

As we build and grow our core team, we have brought together some of the most passionate folks from the world of education, finance, non-profit, venture capital, and technology, to unlock human potential through education. We want to change the world, one student at a time.

This is a remote role open to candidates anywhere in Canada or the US.

What You'll Do

  • Research and analyze competitor backlink profiles to identify high-value opportunities.
  • Prospect and vet websites, blogs, directories, and industry publications for relevant backlink opportunities.
  • Plan, draft, and execute cold email outreach campaigns to secure backlinks from relevant, high-authority domains
  • Conduct outreach campaigns via other platforms like LinkedIn to secure placements.
  • Build and maintain relationships with webmasters, bloggers, journalists, and influencers.
  • Monitor, audit, and report on backlink profiles using SEO tools
  • Ensure all acquired backlinks meet SEO best practices and comply with Google guidelines.
  • Track and report campaign performance, including outreach metrics, links secured, and overall SEO impact.
  • Collaborate with SEO and content teams to align link-building with broader marketing and growth strategies.

Who You Are

  • 2+ proven experience in link building and outreach (agency or in-house).
  • Creative thinker with the ability to design unique outreach angles, campaign ideas, and content hooks that capture attention and earn high-quality backlinks.
  • Strong understanding of SEO principles, especially off-page SEO and backlink acquisition.
  • Proficiency with SEO and outreach tools
  • Excellent written communication skills; ability to craft compelling, personalized outreach messages.
  • Strong organizational, research, and relationship-building skills.
  • Ability to work independently, manage multiple campaigns, and meet deadlines.
  • Self-motivated, adaptable, and results-driven with a focus on continuous improvement.
  • Nice to have: experience with local link building or digital PR

The targeted base pay for this role is: $75,000 CAD. Actual salary is dependent upon several factors, including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities and geographic location. The pay ratio between base pay and target incentive will be finalized at the offer. The pay range is subject to the discretion of the Company.

Why you'll love Inspira

  • Amazing people with a great vision and values
  • Ability to work directly with co-founders and drive impact super quickly
  • Your work directly impacts the lives and careers of students across the globe
  • 100% coverage of health, vision, and dental benefits
  • Flexible Paid-time Off
  • Learning and Development Budget
  • Retirement Savings Plans - 401k with matching
  • Diversity and inclusion programs that promote employee resource groups like OWN (Outreach Women's Network), AAPI, Rainbow (LGBTQIA+), Gender+, LatinX, Black Excellence, Disability Community, and Veterans
  • Note: certain benefits are not provided to 1099 contract worker

Interested in learning more about Inspira Education, please visit Inspira Education Group.

Inspira Education Group does not discriminate based on race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other reason prohibited by law in providing employment opportunities and benefits.

title: Product Manager (m/w/d)

raw.title: Product Manager (m/w/d)
raw.excerpt: deine rolleAls Produktmanager bei SYNAOS inspirierst du dein Produktteam mit deiner Vision!
raw.description:
deine rolle

Als Produktmanager bei SYNAOS inspirierst du dein Produktteam mit deiner Vision! Du weißt, welches Problem als nächstes in Angriff genommen werden muss, um ein Produkt zu entwickeln, das von unseren Kunden und Nutzern geliebt wird und das unser Geschäft vorantreibt.

deine mission

  • Du leitest dein cross-funktionales Softwareentwicklungsteam auf der Grundlage unserer Produktstrategie und deinen fundierten Kenntnissen bzgl. der Branche, des Marktes und unserer Wettbewerber
  • Du stellst sicher, dass die richtigen Lösungen umgesetzt werden, indem du dich auf messbare Produktergebnisse konzentrierst
  • Du verantwortest sowohl die Produkt-Roadmap als auch die erfolgreiche Delivery durch aktive Sprint- und Release-Steuerung
  • Du maximierst die Effektivität unserer Produktentwicklung durch Abstimmung der Prioritäten mit den anderen Produktteams
  • Du stellst den Erfolg anstehender Projekte durch eine hervorragende Betreuung der externen und internen Stakeholder sicher

dein profil

  • Du verfügst über mehrjährige Erfahrung im Software-Produktmanagement und hast als Teil eines Softwareentwicklungsteams gearbeitet.
  • Idealerweise bringst du Knowhow aus dem B2B/Enterprise-Software-Umfeld mit, z.B. in den Bereichen Industrial IoT, Fertigung oder Logistik.
  • Du kannst dich schnell in technische Probleme einarbeiten.
  • Du hast Erfahrung mit agilen Methoden und der aktiven Steuerung von Software-Releases in Zusammenarbeit mit Softwareentwicklungsteams.
  • Du arbeitest ergebnisorientiert und fokussiert.
  • Du zeigst eine ausgeprägte Teamorientierung.
  • Du überzeugst mit deinen exzellenten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.
  • Du besitzt verhandlungssichere Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch.
Wir legen Wert auf Authentizität, Vielfalt, gelebte Erfahrungen und verschiedene Perspektiven. Wenn du motiviert bist und eine Leidenschaft für Technologie mit einer nachgewiesenen Erfolgsbilanz hast, dann solltest du dich unbedingt bewerben. Wir ermutigen ausdrücklich Bewerber/innen aller Geschlechter, ethnischen Zugehörigkeiten, Altersgruppen, Religionen, sexuellen Orientierungen und Fähigkeiten, sich bei uns zu bewerben.

perks & benefits

Schließ dich unserem Team an und sei einfach du selbst - wir feiern Diversität! Unsere unternehmerische Kultur wird von einem talentierten und leidenschaftlichen Team angetrieben. Wir bieten volle Flexibilität, um deine Bedürfnisse zu erfüllen, egal ob du lieber remote, im Büro oder in einer Hybrid-Umgebung arbeiten möchtest. Und wenn du aus dem Ausland arbeiten möchtest, kannst du bis zu 180 Tage remote arbeiten. Aber das ist noch nicht alles! Wir bieten auch ein wettbewerbsfähiges Gehaltspaket und 30 bezahlte Urlaubstage, damit du dich erholen kannst. Hier ist eine Zusammenfassung der Vorteile, die wir bieten:

  • Flexible Arbeitsregelungen (remote, im Büro oder Hybrid)
  • Modernes Büro im Herzen von Hannover für Hybridarbeit
  • Bis zu 180 Tage (6 Monate) Remote-Arbeit aus dem Ausland
  • Wettbewerbsfähige Vergütung mit Zusatzleistungen
  • 30 Tage (6 Wochen) bezahlter Urlaub
  • Moderne Hardware- und Software-Lösungen
  • Corporate Benefits: Zugang zu exklusiven Mitarbeiterrabatten und Vergünstigungen bei einer Vielzahl von Partnerunternehmen

über unsere werte

Ambitioniert, vielversprechend und immer in Bewegung: Das ist SYNAOS. Wir sind ein Team von über 90 Menschen aus 13 Nationen. Wir halten zusammen und arbeiten alle für das gleiche Ziel: eine ganze Branche auf den Kopf zu stellen. Kannst du dich mit unseren Principles identifizieren?

  • We go above & beyond for our customers
  • We always push forward
  • We make informed decisions
  • We challenge each other and win together
  • We seize ownership
  • We make bold moves

raw.title: Senior Short-form Video Editor - (011 - 0527)
raw.excerpt: Job Role: Senior Short-Form Video EditorCompensation range: $1800 - $2200 AUD / MonthlyWork Schedule: This role is expected to align with the AU business hours (approx.
raw.description:
Job Role: Senior Short-Form Video Editor

Compensation range: $1800 - $2200 AUD / Monthly

Work Schedule: This role is expected to align with the AU business hours (approx. 9 AM - 5 PM, Monday to Friday) for collaboration, but as a contractor, you’ll have flexibility in how you manage your time.

Who We Are: At Hunt St we help Australian companies directly hire top 5% remote talent in the Philippines. You will be hired directly by the client, typically as an independent contractor. We are not an outsourcing agency. All of our roles are 100% remote so you'll be able to work from home.

Who The Client Is: A dynamic creative marketing agency located in Brisbane, that focuses on crafting compelling content, producing videos, managing social media, and developing brand strategies to help businesses communicate their message. Built on the idea that thoughtful storytelling creates real impact, the team emphasizes creativity, innovation, and a collaborative, supportive workplace culture.

Role Overview: We're looking for a Senior Short-Form Video Editor to join this Brisbane-based creative agency specialising in content creation and social media management for B2B and service-based businesses.

In this role, you'll transform raw footage into scroll-stopping Instagram Reels, TikToks, YouTube Shorts, and LinkedIn videos. You'll work across multiple client brands, delivering high-volume, high-quality content that drives real engagement and results.

You'll report to the Social Media Manager and collaborate closely with our Social Media Coordinator, Senior Video Editor, and Videographer. We provide all software, storage, and systems — you bring the talent and your own editing workstation.

What Success Looks Like: Consistently producing platform-native video content that looks like it belongs on each client's feed — not like it came from a template factory. You nail the hook in the first 3 seconds, maintain energy throughout, and deliver clean endings that leave viewers satisfied.

You hit deadlines reliably, flag issues early, and require minimal revisions because you've internalised each client's brand guidelines. Your 18th video of the week looks as sharp as your 1st.

This role suits editors who bring creative flair while thriving within defined processes. You're not just executing — you're injecting energy, personality, and storytelling craft into every edit.

What You'll Do:

  • Edit short-form videos (30-90 seconds) from raw footage including podcasts, interviews, events, and B2B content
  • Apply retention editing techniques: pattern interrupts, dynamic pacing, strategic zooms, visual hooks
  • Create burnt-in captions with accurate timing, spelling, and brand-consistent styling
  • Build motion graphics elements: lower thirds, callouts, kinetic text, animated transitions
  • Export multiple versions per video (9:16, 1:1, 4:5) and custom thumbnails as required
  • Maintain brand consistency across high-volume batch production
  • Follow established workflows using ClickUp (project management) and Dropbox (footage & review)

Requirements

  • 3+ years professional video editing experience
  • Expert proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and/or DaVinci Resolve
  • Strong proficiency in Adobe After Effects
  • Intermediate to expert motion graphics skills (lower thirds, kinetic text, animated elements)
  • Proven portfolio showcasing short-form social video content (Reels, TikToks, Shorts)
  • Strong understanding of retention editing and platform-specific pacing
  • Caption creation expertise with excellent spelling and grammar
  • Audio editing fundamentals (levels, EQ, noise reduction)
  • Basic colour correction skills
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Own workstation suitable for video editing (multi-core processor, 16GB+ RAM, dedicated GPU, SSD storage)
  • Reliable high-speed internet connection

Nice to Have

  • Advanced colour grading capabilities

Benefits

What We Offer

  • Full-time, stable position with an established creative agency
  • All software provided (Adobe Creative Cloud, DaVinci Resolve, etc.)
  • Storage drives provided - Initially we will need you to provide your own hard drives etc however long term we would deliver you a NAS.
  • Work across diverse client brands in property, professional services, hospitality, trades, allied health and more
  • Clear processes and brand guidelines — no guesswork
  • Supportive team environment with weekly check-ins

Work Arrangement & Expectations:

This is a remote role that will be set up via an Employer of Record (EOR) service.

To ensure alignment and transparency, successful candidates will be expected to:

  • Be available for meetings and collaboration during core [AEST] business hours
  • Disclose any existing ongoing roles or client work
  • Reflect this engagement on their LinkedIn profile

title: Intern QA Specialist (Paid Internship)
description: Ready to launch your career in Quality Assurance?

raw.title: Intern QA Specialist (Paid Internship)
raw.excerpt: Ready to launch your career in Quality Assurance?
raw.description:
Ready to launch your career in Quality Assurance? If you are eager to master the skills needed to test applications, detect critical bugs, and consistently deliver high-quality products, this is your opportunity. This program is specifically designed to guide aspiring QA professionals who just need the right place to start.
We are a dynamic team focused on building cutting-edge web applications for exciting early-stage startups (MVPs), guaranteeing a job full of diverse and engaging challenges while we craft innovative solutions. Our core tech stack includes React, React Native, Node.js, and TypeScript.

We do not expect experience or in-depth knowledge of testing. We are looking for someone who:

  • Is curious and thinks critically: always looks for shortcomings and asks questions like “what would happen if...”,
  • Likes to ask questions about why things are the way they are,
  • Can describe things clearly: You can document your findings in an understandable way so that others (developers, Product Owners) can easily understand them,
  • The goal is to learn manual testing and quality assurance in the development process, rather than test automation and programming.

Requirements:

  • Strong collaboration skills - you will work closely with the team on a daily basisInterest in manual testing and learning QA processes
  • Interest and willing to learn about software development and testing
  • Good organization, but without fear of chaos
  • Good knowledge of English (minimum B2) and excellent knowledge of Polish (minimum C1)
  • You have a student status

Your future tasks and duties:

  • Close cooperation with experienced QA
  • Assistance in designing tests and implementing web applications for external clients
  • ​​Assist in manual testing, bug reporting
  • Working closely with Developers, Proxy Product Owner, and Product Designers to assure high quality
  • Focusing on quality-oriented rather than defect-oriented testing

Recruitment Process:

  • Complete a small task (deadline: 13.02.2026 - it shouldn’t take more than 30 to 45 minutes to complete :) - you’ll receive feedback no matter the outcome,
  • Send us your task and CV (non-commercial projects are totally fine!) via application form,
  • 30-min Interview with HR,
  • Interview with our specialist + team lead (includes live task review),
  • Feedback and decision 🥳

Link to the task :

  • https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Nq-SL94JBpies4VPWkMqpI9Wfjbj0Q29MlvaeqgkZok/edit?usp=sharing

Perks & Benefits:

  • Paid 3-month internship and mentoring;
  • Option to extend for an additional 3 months;
  • Opportunity to grow into a Junior Quality Assurance role after 6 months;
  • Regular feedback, support, and real learning opportunities;
  • Access to internal Tech Talks.

Bonus points:

  • ISTQB knowledge;
  • Openness to AI & automations tools;
    • No commercial experience? No worries - if you bring the passion and motivation, we’ll teach you the rest!
If you’re looking for a place to truly learn what Quality Assurance is all about - through practice, with real projects and the support of a mentor - this internship might be a perfect fit.

raw.title: Entry-Level Sales  - Remote
raw.excerpt: At The Hunt Agency, we’re a fast-growing, family-led brokerage on a mission to help families secure their financial futures through protection-first financial solutions.
raw.description:
At The Hunt Agency, we’re a fast-growing, family-led brokerage on a mission to help families secure their financial futures through protection-first financial solutions.

We believe in doing business with heart—every interaction should leave people better than we found them. By combining cutting-edge technology with real human connection, we’re changing the way insurance is experienced.

This is a 100% commission-based role designed for driven professionals who want uncapped income potential, flexibility, and long-term growth without income ceilings. Specificaly designed for individuals who want their effort to determine their income.

No cold calls. No door-knocking.
You’ll work with a consistent flow of qualified clients who have already requested information and expressed interest in our services.
What We Do
Our team specializes in helping families protect what matters most through:

  • Mortgage Protection Insurance

  • Life Insurance (term & permanent solutions)

  • Retirement & Income Protection strategies

  • Additional financial protection services tailored to client needs

Responsibilities

  • Master our proven sales systems and product suite

  • Connect with clients who’ve requested information and guide them through the process

  • Conduct virtual consultations via Zoom or phone

  • Communicate with clients and internal teams to ensure seamless service

  • Collaborate with peers and leadership to deliver an exceptional client experience

  • Meet promotional benchmarks to unlock growth and income potential

  • Stay compliant with state insurance and licensing requirements

  • Participate in weekly virtual meetings and trainings

  • Build a long-term client base using company-provided and self-generated leads

  • Help families select the right protection and financial solutions for their needs

Qualifications

  • 3+ years in sales, customer service, or a related field preferred (not required)

  • Confident using technology and virtual communication tools

  • Excellent communicator with strong organizational skills

  • Self-motivated, coachable, and goal-driven

  • Professional presence over Zoom and the phone

  • Customer-oriented with a problem-solving mindset

Requirements

  • Ability to pass a background check

  • Reliable phone, computer, and internet connection

  • Active Life & Health Insurance License (or willingness to obtain within 7–10 days — we’ll help)

  • Flexibility to meet client schedules, including some evenings or weekends

Compensation & Benefits

  • 100% commission-based compensation with uncapped earning potential

  • Performance-based monthly bonuses

  • 100% remote with flexible scheduling

  • Annual incentive trips for top producers (company & carrier sponsored)

  • Access to discounted health and life insurance options

  • Fast-track promotions and leadership opportunities for high performers

If you don’t yet have a Life Insurance License, we’ll walk you through the process and help you get licensed within 7–10 days of onboarding.

description: Titre du posteChef de projets clients bilingue / Customer Project Manager - Connected Care (Quebec)Description de posteL’entreprise Connected Care de Philips Santé est au service de la communauté des soins de santé grâce à la gestion efficace des installations d'équipement médical essentiel et à la mise en œuvre efficace de solutions informatiques à différents stades du continuum des soins de santé.

raw.title: Chef de projets clients bilingue / Customer Project Manager - Connected Care (Qu
raw.excerpt: Titre du posteChef de projets clients bilingue / Customer Project Manager - Connected Care (Quebec)Description de posteL’entreprise Connected Care de Philips Santé est au service de la communauté des soins de santé grâce à la gestion efficace des installations d'équipement médical essentiel et à la mise en œuvre efficace de solutions informatiques à différents stades du continuum des soins de santé.
raw.description:
Titre du poste

Chef de projets clients bilingue / Customer Project Manager - Connected Care (Quebec)

Description de poste

L’entreprise Connected Care de Philips Santé est au service de la communauté des soins de santé grâce à la gestion efficace des installations d'équipement médical essentiel et à la mise en œuvre efficace de solutions informatiques à différents stades du continuum des soins de santé. Votre rôle en tant que chef de projets clients consiste à gérer de multiples systèmes de monitorage des patients ou la mise en œuvre de soins thérapeutiques dont la portée, la taille et la complexité varient.  Les projets peuvent inclure des solutions informatiques, l’installation d’équipement essentiel et l’intégration de systèmes.  Vous aurez également la responsabilité de diriger une équipe clinique et technique pour chaque projet, afin d’assurer une expérience client satisfaisante et le respect de l’énoncé des travaux défini.

Votre rôle

  • Élaborer des plans de projet qui comprennent les éléments suivants à l’aide de la méthodologie de gestion de projets de Philips : structure de répartition du travail complète, plan de gestion des changements, plan de communication, plan de gestion des risques, analyse des parties prenantes et plan de gestion des ressources.

  • Coordonner, diriger et motiver une équipe interfonctionnelle diversifiée composée de ressources commerciales, cliniques et techniques internes et externes, en collaboration avec le chef de projet ou les personnes-ressources de l’hôpital.

  • Être responsable de la communication efficace avec toutes les parties prenantes du projet et tous les fournisseurs tiers, incluant notamment les mises à jour et les réunions régulières du projet, comme indiqué dans le plan du projet.

  • Collaborer, à l’occasion, avec les équipes commerciales, cliniques et techniques concernées au cours de la phase préalable à la vente afin de déterminer la meilleure solution pour un client particulier, et de s’assurer de la faisabilité de la solution technique et de la manière dont elle répondra aux attentes du client.

  • Être responsable de la gestion prévisionnelle des stocks, de la durée des projets, de l’exactitude des prévisions, de la constatation des recettes et de la satisfaction des clients.

  • De bonnes capacités de communication en français (à l'oral et à l'écrit) sont requises pour ce poste.

  • Le titulaire de ce poste travaille à domicile et peut être appelé à se déplacer jusqu’à 50 % du temps.

Vous êtes le bon candidat si vous répondez aux critères ci-dessous.

  • Vous avez acquis au moins deux ans d’expérience dans la gestion de projets, de préférence dans un environnement de soins de santé ou de technologie (p. ex. TI des soins de santé, surveillance des patients, intégration informatique, développement de logiciels).

  • Vous disposez de compétences démontrées quant à l’utilisation de MS Project et d’autres outils et documents de gestion de projets normalisés. Vous êtes capable de démontrer votre capacité à exercer un leadership influent et efficace auprès de toutes les ressources et parties prenantes des projets. Vous êtes également capable de négocier efficacement, de satisfaire pleinement les clients et de gérer et diriger plusieurs projets simultanément.

  • Vous êtes titulaire d’un baccalauréat ou avez acquis une combinaison équivalente d’expérience et de formation dans les domaines suivants : sciences cliniques ou informatiques, technologies de l'information, gestion de projets. La préférence sera accordée aux titulaires d’une certification en gestion de projets (certificat de professionnel en gestion de projets ou certificat de maîtrise en gestion de projets). La certification LEAN est également un atout.

  • Vous êtes un leader solide, doté d'excellentes compétences en matière d'organisation, de présentation, de relations interpersonnelles et de communication. Vous disposez d'excellentes capacités de communication, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit, dans la langue locale comme en anglais.

À propos de Philips

Nous sommes une entreprise en technologies de la santé. Nous avons bâti toute notre entreprise sur la conviction que chaque être humain est important, et nous ne nous arrêterons pas tant que tout le monde, partout, n’aura pas accès aux soins de santé de qualité que nous méritons tous. Faites le travail de votre vie pour aider à améliorer la vie des autres.

  • En savoir plus sur notre entreprise.

  • Découvrez notre histoire riche et passionnante.

  • En savoir plus sur notre objectif.

Détails relatifs à la transparence salariale de Philips

La fourchette de rémunération pour ce poste est de 74 900 $ à 117 700 $. Le salaire de base réel offert peut varier à l’intérieur des fourchettes indiquées en fonction de multiples facteurs, notamment les connaissances/compétences liées à l’emploi, l’expérience, les besoins de l’entreprise, la situation géographique et l’équité interne.

​

En outre, d’autres rémunérations, telles qu’une prime de rendement annuelle, une commission sur les ventes ou des primes incitatives à long terme, peuvent être offertes. Les employés peuvent participer au programme complet d’avantages sociaux de Philips, qui comprend de généreux congés personnels, un régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées, des dollars Flex (pour le CSS/CDP/RÉER), un plan d’achat d’actions, le remboursement des frais d’éducation et bien d’autres choses encore. Les détails relatifs à nos avantages sociaux pour le Canada sont accessibles ici.​

​

Chez Philips, il n’est pas courant qu’une personne soit embauchée au niveau le plus élevé de la fourchette pour son poste, ou à un niveau proche, et les décisions en matière de rémunération dépendent des faits et des circonstances de chaque cas.

Renseignements supplémentaires

Un permis de travail canadien est une condition préalable à l’emploi. L’entreprise ne tiendra pas compte des demandes provenant de candidats qui nécessitent un parrainage pour obtenir un permis de travail, maintenant ou à l’avenir.

L’entreprise n’offre aucune indemnité de déménagement pour ce poste. Pour ce poste, vous devez résider sur le territoire ou à une distance raisonnable de Québec, au Canada.

The Philips Healthcare Connected Care business serves the healthcare community through effective and efficient management of capital medical equipment installations and IT solution implementation at various stages across the healthcare continuum. Your role as Customer Project Manager is to manage multiple patient monitoring systems and/or therapeutic care implementations that vary in scope, size and complexity. Projects can include IT solutions, capital equipment installation and systems integration. You will also be responsible for leading a clinical and technical team for each project, to ensure successful customer experience and adherence to the defined statement of work.

Your role:

  • Developing project plans; inclusive of the following elements, utilizing the Philips Project Management Methodology: Comprehensive WBS (work breakdown structure), Change Management Plan, Communication Plan, Risk Management Plan, Stakeholder Analysis and Resource Management Plan.

  • Coordinating, leading and motivating a diverse cross-functional team of internal and external Sales, Clinical and Technical resources in coordination with the hospital provided project manager or point(s) of contact.

  • Responsible for effectively communicating with all project stakeholders, and third-party vendors. Including but not limited to regular project updates and regular project meetings as outlined in the project plan.

  • May be required to work with the applicable Sales, Clinical, and technical teams in the pre-sales phase to determine the best solution for a particular customer to assure the feasibility of the technical solution and how it will meet customer expectations.

  • The Customer Project Manager will be responsible for Forward Looking Inventory Management, Project Cycle Time, Forecast Accuracy, Revenue Recognition, and Customer Satisfaction.

  • Good communication skills in French Language (Verbal and Written) are required for this role.

  • This is a home-based position with travel up to 50% of the time.

You're the right fit if:

  • You’ve acquired 2+ years’ experience in Project Management preferably within a Healthcare or Technology Environment (i.e. Healthcare IT, Patient Monitoring, IT Integration, Software Development).

  • Your skills include a demonstrated proficiency in the use of MS Project and other standardized Project Management tools and documentation. You’re able to demonstrate effective influential leadership across all project resources/stakeholders. You also can effectively negotiate, deliver highly satisfied customer experiences, and effectively manage and lead multiple projects concurrently.

  • You have a Bachelor’s degree (required), or an equivalent combined experience/education in the areas of: Clinical or Computer Science, Information Technology, Project Management. Certification in Project Management preferred (PMP or Masters Certificate in Project Management). LEAN Certification is also helpful.

  • You’re a strong leader with excellent organization, presentation, interpersonal and communication skills. You have exceptional communication both verbally and in writing, in local language as well as English.

About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help improve the lives of others.

  • Learn more about our business.
  • Discover our rich and exciting history.
  • Learn more about our purpose.
  • Learn more about our culture.

Philips Transparency Details

The pay range for this position is $74,900 to $117,700. The actual base pay offered may vary within the posted ranges depending on multiple factors including job-related knowledge/skills, experience, business needs, geographical location, and internal equity.  

​

In addition, other compensation, such as an annual incentive bonus, sales commission or long-term incentives may be offered. Employees are eligible to participate in our comprehensive Philips Total Rewards benefits program, which includes a generous PTO, DC Pension, Flex Dollars (for HSA/PSA/RRSP), stock purchase plan, education reimbursement and much more. Details about our Canada benefits can be found here. ​

​

At Philips, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top end of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent upon the facts and circumstances of each case.

Additional Information

Canadian work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa, now or in the future.

For this position, you must reside in or within commuting distance to Quebec, Canada.

Philips Canada is committed to treating all people in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Senior Manager of Strategic Operations
description: Senior Manager of Strategic Operations, Operations (Remote) Full-Time, Remote / Salary, Exempt Includes Benefits, PTO, Flexible Schedule, Equity Steno is growing!

raw.title: Senior Manager of Strategic Operations
raw.excerpt: Senior Manager of Strategic Operations, Operations (Remote) Full-Time, Remote / Salary, Exempt Includes Benefits, PTO, Flexible Schedule, Equity Steno is growing!
raw.description:
Senior Manager of Strategic Operations, Operations (Remote)

Full-Time, Remote / Salary, Exempt

Includes Benefits, PTO, Flexible Schedule, Equity

Steno is growing! We’re looking for a Senior Manager of Strategic Operations to join our winning team, which is revolutionizing the court reporting industry every single day. We’re a diverse team from all over the country (and beyond) and we’re crazy about redefining the boundaries of an outdated industry.

In this role, you will be the go-to problem solver for leadership when complex challenges arise. Reporting directly to the Director of Strategic Operations, you'll take ownership of high-impact initiatives from conception through execution. Your days will involve running strategic assessments, building compelling business cases, and delivering data-driven recommendations that directly influence how the company operates and grows.

Who are you?

We’re looking for someone who thrives in ambiguity, digs deep into data to uncover insights, and is driven to deliver real change across the organization. You move beyond traditional analysis—you're hands-on in implementing solutions, combining rigorous structured thinking with the speed and agility of a startup environment. You want genuine ownership, see problems as opportunities, and are energized by the challenge of scaling a growing company.

If you’re looking for a company that offers support, guidance, an abundance of killer giphys, and unlimited potential to grow into your best self, you can bet we’d love to have you too.

On a regular basis you will

  • Take ambiguous problems and turn them into clear frameworks and action plans, owning initiatives end-to-end—scope them, build the plan, and see them through
  • Run strategic assessments (market entry, vendor evaluations, competitive analysis) and deliver recommendations leadership can act on
  • Lead cross-functional initiatives that span Sales, Operations, Product, and RevOps, keeping teams aligned and accountable while becoming the trusted expert on business best practices across the organization
  • Design processes and workflows that scale with a growing business
  • Build fluency in our data—uncover insights that shape decisions and surface trends before anyone asks
  • Use storytelling to communicate business insights and your recommendations by pulling, structuring, and presenting data to diverse audiences
  • Build dashboards that tell a clear story about how the business is performing and support teams to make the right decisions
  • Translate complex data into insights non-technical colleagues can act on

You’re gonna crush it if

  • You have 5-7+ years in consulting and strategy & ops (preferably with a high-growth startup)
  • You have strong SQL skills and are comfortable with BI tools (Looker, Tableau) and Python or similar
  • You have a track record building dashboards and translating data into executive-ready insights
  • You have sharp structured thinking—you break down ambiguous problems into clear frameworks
  • You have experience leading cross-functional projects and managing senior stakeholders
  • You're tech-fluent—comfortable navigating and optimizing operational systems
  • You have a bias for action; you ship, not just recommend

Bonus Points if

  • You have experience at a top-tier consulting firm or high-growth startup
  • You have experience with Snowflake or modern data stack (dbt, Fivetran)
  • You have a background in legal tech, professional services, or marketplace businesses

Compensation & Benefits

  • Salary - $120,000 - $150,000
  • Health, Vision, & Dental Benefits - low-cost health plans that free up mind space and unlock our employees' best work
  • Wellness/Mental Health - shared benefits to be used among employees and families
  • Flexible Paid Time Off - allowing employees to find balance in their lives
  • Options of Equity - we know our success is nothing without our team
  • Access to a company-provided 401(k) account
  • A home office setup and a monthly stipend to offset internet and phone costs

Our Team

The Operations team at Steno is essential to our success, and as a key support to the COO, you’ll play a vital role in this dynamic environment. You’ll help ensure that our production, billing, provider operations, customer success, and remote services teams are running smoothly, and delivering high-quality legal services.

About Steno

  • Founded in 2018 and growing fast!
  • Values: be highly reliable, constantly innovate, operate with a hospitality mindset
  • Diverse backgrounds welcome! Steno employees have a unique blend of legal, technology, operations and finance experience
  • We are revolutionizing the litigation and court reporting industry
    • Flexible deferred payment options (e.g., DelayPay)
    • Cutting-edge technology - unique products and integrations to maximize the output of legal professionals
    • White glove, concierge customer service that our clients rave about

Application Information

  • Steno is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on any characteristics that are protected under the law. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.
  • Applicants needing special assistance or accommodations for interviews or website access should contact us at accommodations@steno.com.
  • Steno personnel will always have either a steno.com email address or will contact you via Rippling Recruiting. Act with caution if asked for personal information. Background checks, for example, are only conducted after an offer is extended.
  • Applicants should receive a confirmation email immediately after applying. If you haven’t received it, check your email spam folder and approve the sender address to ensure receipt of future communications.
  • Information provided to Steno, such as professional credentials and skills, educational and work history, the results of technical skills assessments or working exercises, and other information that may be included on a resume or application, is collected and stored in our system. Still, we never disclose or sell your personal information.

raw.title: Senior Product Manager- Spain Remote (Barcelona, B, ES, 08019)
raw.excerpt: Our TeamThe Access team plays a critical role in securing and enabling the Mass Customization Platform (MCP), the technology backbone that powers Cimpress businesses such as VistaPrint, National Pen, and others.
raw.description:
Our Team

The Access team plays a critical role in securing and enabling the Mass Customization Platform (MCP), the technology backbone that powers Cimpress businesses such as VistaPrint, National Pen, and others. The team is responsible for onboarding businesses, managing users, and safeguarding the platform through robust Identity, Authentication, Tenancy, Account Management, Authorization, Risk Intelligence, and Compliance solutions. Our systems ensure that every person, service, and application that intends and is permitted to connect with the MCP can do so securely and operate with the right level of trust and control.

As a Senior Product Manager, you will own the product direction and execution for critical functional areas within our Identity and Access Management (IAM) and extended portfolio. You will serve as the bridge between high-level platform strategy and on-the-ground execution. You will take ownership of sophisticated problem spaces such as identity, authentication, authorization, tenancy, and risk intelligence and drive them from vague requirements to successful global adoption. You will operate with ahigh degree of autonomy, influencing partners across Cimpress businesses, and ensuring our services evolve to support emerging technologies, including AI agents and third-party ecosystem integrations.

What You Will Do

  • Execute the Product Strategy: Define and implement the quarterly and annual product roadmap for significant components of the Access products, translating high-level strategic goals into detailed, actionable plans and measurable outcomes.

  • Deep Customer & Market Discovery: Lead continuous market research, competitive analysis, and deep-dive discovery with Cimpress business units to identify unarticulated needs. Use data and insights to validate hypotheses, prioritize high-impact features, and lead "build vs. buy" evaluations for critical Access related product technologies.

  • Drive Solution Design and Development: Collaborate closely with engineering, security, and architecture teams to translate large-scale initiatives into a clear, prioritized backlog. Act as a trusted partner, navigating technical trade-offs, and collaborating on system design, API contracts, and architectural decisions.

  • Champion User-Centricity and Security: Ensure our products adhere to strong UX principles, making APIs, SDKs, and tools intuitive, well-documented, and easy to integrate. Champion a secure, scalable, and API-first foundation for the products you handle.

  • Stakeholder Management and Alignment: Collaborate across the organization with business units, platform teams, and partners to ensure Access solutions meet real-world needs while balancing security, usability, and scalability. Effectively manage expectations and communicate progress, risks, and changes across all Cimpress businesses.

  • Measure and Improve Outcomes: Continuously refine product features and operational processes using adoption metrics, platform performance data, and customer feedback.

Your Qualifications

At Cimpress, we are striving to hire individuals that add new ideas and perspectives to our teams and enhance our culture. No matter your background or work experience, we strongly encourage you to apply—even if you feel that you don’t meet the exact requirements or have the same qualifications. You might be a great candidate for this or other opportunities.

  • Product Management Experience: 8+ years of professional experience, including 5+ years as a Product Manager, ideally working on complex, high-quality B2B or B2C web-based products, preferably in the SaaS space.

  • Deep Domain Expertise: Proven track record in one or more of the following: Identity & Access Management (IAM), Authentication protocols (OAuth, OIDC, SAML), Granular Application Access Control, Security and Compliance, Role-based Access Management, Policy-based Access Management, or Platform tenancy.

  • Security Context: Exposure to Risk Intelligence, Trust & Safety, or Compliance products within high-volume B2B platforms (e.g., FinTech/Payments), SaaS, or sophisticated e-commerce ecosystems.

Nice to Have

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Computer/IT/Electronics Engineering and/or previous s/w development experience is a huge advantage

  • Exposure to one of these areas: SAML, OAuth, OpenID Connect, Social SignOn, SSO, LDAP, Okta, Auth0, Authz, OPA, Authzed, integrating with API-first products, Payment fraud, Account takeover, Sanctions/AML screening, data privacy compliances (GDPR, etc.)

  • Ability to create concept wireframes.

  • Exposure to Agentic AI products

Why You'll Love Working Here

We encourage our engineers to think like owners – to continue to act small as we grow. Every team defines their own roadmaps, and uses the programming languages and technologies that suit them best. This helps us have a big impact at the enterprise level while still feeling small and nimble. We have a Remote-First operating model and culture, with team members in over 15 countries and 30 US states, offering autonomy and the flexibility to work from home. Cimpress also provides collaboration spaces for team members to work physically together.

About Us

Led by founder and CEO Robert Keane, Cimpress invests in and helps build customer-focused, entrepreneurial mass customization businesses. Cimpress Technology develops cutting-edge, best-in-world software that our mass customization businesses use to create personalized physical (and digital) products, for over 17 million global customers. Our businesses can choose the solutions that work for them, or assemble any custom combination they need. This makes it easier and faster to do things like introduce new products, reach customers and track orders. And this kind of innovation keeps customers coming back.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

Cimpress exists to help our customers live their dreams. Each dream is unique – and the Cimpress team needs to be as well. We believe in the unique contributions of everyone within a diverse global organization. We are collaborative, inclusive, and innovative. We strive to role model and live an inclusive culture of fairness, respect and belonging for all. And we work together to empower each other, creating a space in which each of us can spark our next great idea.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Cimpress Technology, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

raw.description:
Please submit your CV in English and indicate your level of English proficiency.

Mindrift connects specialists with project-based AI opportunities for leading tech companies, focused on testing, evaluating, and improving AI systems. Participation is project-based, not permanent employment.

What this opportunity involves

While each project involves unique tasks, contributors may:

  • Create structured test cases that simulate complex human workflows
  • Define gold-standard behavior and scoring logic to evaluate agent actions
  • Analyze agent logs, failure modes, and decision paths
  • Work with code repositories and test frameworks to validate your scenarios
  • Iterate on prompts, instructions, and test cases to improve clarity and difficulty
  • Ensure that scenarios are production-ready, easy to run, and reusable

What we look for

This opportunity is a good fit for software engineers, open to part-time, non-permanent projects. Ideally, contributors will have:

  • 3+ of software development experience with strong Python focus
  • Experience with Git and code repositories
  • Comfortable with structured formats like JSON/YAML for scenario description
  • Understanding core LLM limitations (hallucinations, bias, context limits) and how these affect evaluation design
  • Familiarity with Docker
  • English proficiency - B2

How it works

Apply → Pass qualification(s) → Join a project → Complete tasks → Get paid

Project time expectations

Tasks for this project are estimated to take 6-10 hours to complete, depending on complexity. This is an estimate and not a schedule requirement; you choose when and how to work. Tasks must be submitted by the deadline and meet the listed acceptance criteria to be accepted.

Payment

  • Paid contributions, with rates up to $30/hour*
  • Fixed project rate or individual rates, depending on the project
  • Some projects include incentive payments

*Note: Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project needs, and other factors. Higher rates may be offered to highly specialized experts. Lower rates may apply during onboarding or non-core project phases. Payment details are shared per project.

title: Senior Director Client Reporting and Analytics
description: About Omada HealthOmada Health is a virtual-first care provider that combines clinical programs, behavior change, and personalized coaching to help people achieve lasting health outcomes.

raw.title: Senior Director Client Reporting and Analytics
raw.excerpt: About Omada HealthOmada Health is a virtual-first care provider that combines clinical programs, behavior change, and personalized coaching to help people achieve lasting health outcomes.
raw.description:
About Omada Health

Omada Health is a virtual-first care provider that combines clinical programs, behavior change, and personalized coaching to help people achieve lasting health outcomes. We partner with employers, health plans, and providers to deliver measurable impact across chronic disease prevention and management.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Director, Customer Reporting & Insights to define, scale, and elevate Omada’s customer-facing analytics and reporting function. This leader will set the strategic vision for how Omada demonstrates measurable value to its customers—translating data into insight, insight into story, and story into renewed partnership and growth.

This role sits at the intersection of data, storytelling, and strategy. The Senior Director will oversee both a data analytics team and a product marketer, driving the design and delivery of Omada’s customer reporting experience—from standardized dashboards to high-touch executive deliverables for strategic clients.

You will play a critical role in showcasing Omada’s differentiated impact across outcomes, engagement, and ROI—ensuring our insights not only inform but inspire our customers.

What You’ll Do

Strategic Leadership

Develop and execute the enterprise vision for Omada’s customer reporting strategy ensuring alignment with business priorities, customer expectations, and evolving healthcare market needs.Define a scalable framework for delivering customer-facing metrics, balancing standardization with flexibility for strategic accounts.Establish reporting as a core differentiator in renewal, upsell, and partnership conversations with customers.

Client Reporting & Analytics

  • Oversee design, development, and delivery of all customer-facing reports and dashboards.
  • Ensuse data accuracy, consistency, and storytelling excellence across all outputs.
  • Build and manage a professional services reporting model for Omada’s largest clients, while maintaining an efficient, automated foundation for the broader customer base.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Partner with Clinical, Product, Customer Success, Data Science, and Sales leaders to align reporting strategy with company goals.
  • Collaborate with Product and BI teams to continuously enhance the tools, data pipelines, and visualization platforms that power reporting.
  • Navigate complex contractual and outcomes-based reporting requirements with Legal and Finance teams.
  • Partner with Customer Success and Sales leadership to position reporting as a key driver of renewals, upsells, and strategic partnerships.

People Leadership & Development

  • Build and lead a multidisciplinary team spanning data analytics, reporting operations, and product marketing.
  • Define team structure, roles, and professional development paths to support scalability and innovation.
  • Foster a culture of curiosity, excellence, and impact.

Storytelling & Differentiation

  • Translate clinical, behavioral, and business data into compelling narratives that showcase Omada’s value and impact for our customers.
  • Partner with marketing and communications teams to align data storytelling with Omada’s brand and competitive positioning.
  • Equip Customer Success and Sales with executive-ready insights that strengthen renewal and expansion opportunities.
  • Use comprehensive understanding of the competitive landscape to inform the development of best in class client reporting illustrating Omada’s differentiated impact.

Advance Analytics, Intelligence, & Scale

  • Collaborate with Data Engineering, BI, and Product leadership to continuously enhance pipelines, platforms, and tools that power customer-facing reporting.
  • Drive automation, scalability, and data quality to support consistent, reliable delivery of insights.
  • Identify opportunities to evolve reporting into predictive and prescriptive analytics that inform customer strategy.

About You

Experience & Background

  • 15+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or healthcare reporting, with 8+ years leading at the Director/Senior Director level.
  • Energized by the opportunity to build out Customer Reporting and Analytics as a function.
  • Deep understanding of healthcare contracts, billing models, and B2B2C dynamics, with proven success supporting enterprise-level customers.
  • Track record of designing, scaling, and leading reporting functions that deliver measurable business impact.
  • Skilled at shaping data-driven narratives for C-suite and senior executives.
  • Expertise in BI and visualization platforms (Looker, Tableau, Power BI) and their integration into customer-facing environments.
  • Exceptional people leadership with experience building multi-level teams and influencing cross-functional stakeholders at scale.
  • Strategic, customer-focused mindset with outstanding communication, storytelling, and relationship-building skills.

Mindset & Leadership

  • Strategic thinker who can toggle between vision and execution.
  • Exceptional communicator who can translate data into clear, compelling narratives.
  • Customer-obsessed leader who measures success by the value delivered to clients.
  • Confident operating in matrixed organizations and influencing senior stakeholders across functions.
  • Passionate about data integrity, design excellence, and driving organizational change through insight.

It takes a village to change health care. As we build together toward our mission, we strive to embody the following values in our day-to-day work. We hope these hold meaning for you as well as you consider Omada!

  • Cultivate Trust. We listen closely and we operate with kindness. We provide respectful and candid feedback to each other.
  • Seek Context. We ask to understand and we build connections. We do our research up front to move faster down the road.
  • Act Boldly. We innovate daily to solve problems, improve processes, and find new opportunities for our members and customers.
  • Deliver Results. We reward impact above output. We set a high bar, we’re not afraid to fail, and we take pride in our work.
  • Succeed Together. We prioritize Omada’s progress above team or individual. We have fun as we get stuff done, and we celebrate together.
  • Remember Why We’re Here. We push through the challenges of changing health care because we know the destination is worth it.

About Omada Health:Omada Health is a between-visit healthcare provider that addresses lifestyle and behavior change elements for individuals managing chronic conditions. Omada’s multi-condition platform treats diabetes, hypertension, prediabetes, musculoskeletal, and GLP-1 management. With insights from connected devices and AI-supported tools, Omada care teams deliver care that is rooted in evidence and unique to every member, unlocking results at scale. With more than a decade of experience and data, and 29 peer-reviewed publications showcasing clinical and economic proof points, Omada’s approach is designed to improve health outcomes and contain costs. Our customers include health plans, pharmacy benefit managers, health systems, and employers ranging from small businesses to Fortune 500s. At Omada, we aim to inspire and empower people to make lasting health changes on their own terms. For more information, visit: https://www.omadahealth.com/

Omada is thrilled to share that we’ve been certified as a Great Place to Work! Please click here for more information.

We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.

Below is a summary of salary ranges for this role in the following geographies:

California, New York State and Washington State Base Compensation Ranges: $220,800 - $276,000*, Colorado Base Compensation Ranges: $211,200 - $264,000*. Other states may vary.

This role is also eligible for participation in annual cash bonus and equity grants.

*The actual offer, including the compensation package, is determined based on multiple factors, such as the candidate's skills and experience, and other business considerations.

Please click here for more information on our Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Cyber Security Specialist
description: Charger Logistics is a world class asset-based carrier.

raw.title: Cyber Security Specialist
raw.excerpt: Charger Logistics is a world class asset-based carrier.
raw.description:
Charger Logistics is a world class asset-based carrier. We specialize in delivering assets, on time and on budget. With the diverse fleet of equipment, we can handle a range of freight, including dedicated loads, specialized hauls, temperature-controlled goods and HAZMAT cargo.

Charger logistics invests time and support into its employees to provide them with the room to learn and grow their expertise and work their way up.

Responsibilities:-

  • Administer and configure security tools including FortiGate, and Cloudflare firewalls, ensuring comprehensive security for cloud workloads, networks, and endpoints.
  • Implement and manage firewall rules and security policies across cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, and GCP, optimizing the organization’s infrastructure protection.
  • Apply advanced micro-segmentation techniques using tools like Illumio to protect east-west traffic and enhance internal security.
  • Manage web proxies such as Palo Alto, FortiGate, Cisco Umbrella, and Zscaler, ensuring secure internet access for the organization.
  • Conduct audits and security improvements for various security tools and devices such as WAF, DLP, APT, IDS, IPS, Firewalls, EDR, CASB.
  • Perform regular SOC and SecOps maturity assessments, identifying gaps, assessing risks, and recommending mitigation strategies.
  • Investigate, document, and respond to information security incidents using tools such as Nessus Tenable, Qualysguard, Darktrace, and Azure Sentinel.
  • Administer and support SD-WAN, VPN Tunnels, and other network security measures across multi-cloud environments, ensuring secure communications.
  • Collaborate with compliance teams to ensure adherence to frameworks like ISO 27001 and SOC 2, creating reports and ensuring audit readiness.
  • Stay updated with emerging security trends and provide training to employees on information security best practices.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field, or equivalent experience.
  • 5+ years of experience in IT Security with hands-on expertise in firewall management (Palo Alto, FortiGate, Checkpoint), cloud security (Azure, AWS, GCP), and micro-segmentation (Illumio).
  • Proficiency in network threat detection and vulnerability assessment using tools like Nessus, Qualysguard, Darktrace, and Azure Sentinel.
  • In-depth knowledge of IPSec, VPNs, SSL, DNS, NAC, and cloud security platforms.
  • Industry-relevant certifications such as AWS Security, Azure Security, CEH, PCNSE, and ITIL are preferred.
  • Proven experience in managing complex, secure environments across hybrid infrastructures

Benefits

  • Competitive Salary
  • Career Growth

title: Talent Development Partner III
description: Job Summary: The Talent Development Partner III plays a pivotal role in advancing our organization's learning culture and performance by designing, developing, and facilitating innovative and high-impact learning experiences that build professional and leadership skills and capability, strengthen team dynamics, and foster a culture of continuous learning.

raw.title: Talent Development Partner III
raw.excerpt: Job Summary: The Talent Development Partner III plays a pivotal role in advancing our organization's learning culture and performance by designing, developing, and facilitating innovative and high-impact learning experiences that build professional and leadership skills and capability, strengthen team dynamics, and foster a culture of continuous learning.
raw.description:
Job Summary:

The Talent Development Partner III plays a pivotal role in advancing our organization's learning culture and performance by designing, developing, and facilitating innovative and high-impact learning experiences that build professional and leadership skills and capability, strengthen team dynamics, and foster a culture of continuous learning. This role partners with HR, business leaders, and subject matter experts to assess development needs, deliver scalable learning solutions, and embed talent development into the core of our business.

Essential Functions:

  • Partner with HR Business Partners, business leaders and stakeholders to assess learning needs and identify competency/skill gaps aligned with organizational strategy.
  • Conduct comprehensive needs assessments to create and implement customized learning and development plans that drive individual and team performance and engagement.
  • Translate business objectives into learning strategies, curricula and roadmaps that support talent growth and performance improvement
  • Design and deliver high-impact, learner-centered development experiences including virtual instructor-led training (vILT), videos, and other on-demand resources using adult learning theory and instructional design best-practices.
  • Creates clear, visually engaging instructional materials—including slide decks, participant guides, and job aids—that reflect sound instructional design and visual communication principles. Ensuring materials are accessible, inclusive, and aligned with brand and learning objectives.
  • Applies a variety of facilitation methods (e.g., discussion-based learning, simulations, experiential activities, peer learning, and role plays) to deepen understanding and behavior change and demonstrates confident facilitation presence and the ability to manage group dynamics in diverse audiences and settings.
  • Design and facilitation responsibilities may include topics around developmental learning, critical organizational wide skills, mentoring experiences, new hire orientation, leadership development, promotion readiness, or team learning and engagement sessions.
  • Manages project details and uses data to refine learning, demonstrate ROI, and inform future learning strategies.
  • Takes ownership of learning projects and requests, managing timelines, deliverables, and stakeholder updates to ensure commitments are met and outcomes are achieved.
  • Manage logistics for learning offerings including scheduling calendar, roster management, and conducting learning assessments using LMS platforms and other technology.
  • Define and track key metrics and effectiveness measures (e.g., participant feedback, behavior change, business impact) for all learning initiatives.
  • Perform any other job related duties as requested.

Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Organizational Development, Learning and Development, Education, Human Resources, or a related field is required
  • Master's degree in Organizational Development, Learning and Development, or related field is preferred
  • Equivalent years of relevant work experience may be accepted in lieu of required education
  • Five (5) years of experience in learning and development, instructional design and/or facilitation in a corporate environment. required
  • Proven track record designing and delivering learning programs for varied audiences (individual contributors and/or leaders) using adult learning theory. required
  • Demonstrated ability to partner with stakeholders at all levels, manage multiple priorities, and measure learning outcomes. required
  • Experience using learning evaluation methods and tools (e.g., Kirkpatrick, surveys, feedback loops) required

Competencies, Knowledge and Skills:

  • Excellent communication, facilitation, and presentation skills (virtual and in-person).
  • Proficiency in adult learning and design methodologies, instructional design, LMS or learning platform administration, and experience with blended/virtual learning delivery.
  • Strong business acumen and ability to link learning to business goals
  • Analytical mindset with ability to assess data and metrics
  • Project management and organizational skills
  • Strong interpersonal, influencing, collorative, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Adaptability to a fast-paced and evolving environment

Licensure and Certification:

  • Certification or demonstrated experience facilitating team and individual assessments (e.g., DiSC, MBTI, CliftonStrengths, or similar frameworks) preferred

Working Conditions:

  • General office environment; may be required to sit or stand for extended periods of time
  • Up to 15% (Occasional) travel based on the needs of the department may be required

Compensation Range:

$72,200.00 - $115,500.00

CareSource takes into consideration a combination of a candidate’s education, training, and experience as well as the position’s scope and complexity, the discretion and latitude required for the role, and other external and internal data when establishing a salary level. In addition to base compensation, you may qualify for a bonus tied to company and individual performance. We are highly invested in every employee’s total well-being and offer a substantial and comprehensive total rewards package.

Compensation Type (hourly/salary):

Salary

Organization Level Competencies

  • Fostering a Collaborative Workplace Culture

  • Cultivate Partnerships

  • Develop Self and Others

  • Drive Execution

  • Influence Others

  • Pursue Personal Excellence

  • Understand the Business

This job description is not all inclusive. CareSource reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. CareSource is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to fostering an environment of belonging that welcomes and supports individuals of all backgrounds.
